00014 #ifndef POLYGONDEFECTS_H 
00015 #define POLYGONDEFECTS_H 
00016 
00017 #include "config.h"
00018 #include <iterator>
00019 #include <vector>
00020 #include "GnuPlotDump.h"
00021 #include "InsideUtil.h"
00022 
00023 namespace GfxUtil {
00024 
00030 template <class VECTOR, class ITERATOR>
00031 void
00032 removeSomePolygonDefects( VECTOR& output,
00033                           const ITERATOR& begin,
00034                           const ITERATOR& end )
00035 {
00036    output.clear();
00037    back_insert_iterator<VECTOR> outIt( output );
00038 
00039    if ( begin == end ) {
00040       mc2dbg8 << "[removeSomePolygonDefects]: Empty range" << endl;
00041       // Empty range
00042       return;
00043    }
00044 
00045    // Do stuff
00046    ITERATOR prev = begin;
00047    
00048    ITERATOR middle = prev;
00049    ++middle; 
00050 
00051    if ( middle == end ) {
00052       // One coordinate in range
00053       mc2dbg8 << "[removeSomePolygonDefects]: One coordinate in range" << endl;
00054       return;
00055    }
00056 
00057    ITERATOR next = middle;
00058    ++next;
00059    if ( next == end ) {
00060       // Only two coordinates in range
00061       mc2dbg8 << "[removeSomePolygonDefects]: Only two coordinates range" << endl;
00062       return;
00063    }
00064 
00065 
00066    // We have at least three coordinates.
00067    bool firstTime = true;
00068    ITERATOR stopIt = next;
00069    ITERATOR last = end; 
00070 
00071    bool stupid = false;
00072  
00073    // Placeholder for first coordinate.
00074    *outIt++ = *begin;
00075    
00076    while ( firstTime || next != stopIt ) {
00077       firstTime = false;
00078       // Handle wrapping.
00079       if ( next == end ) {
00080          next = begin;
00081          // Also store the last coordinate in the original.
00082          last = middle;
00083       }
00084       MC2_ASSERT( middle != end );
00085 
00086 
00087 
00088       if ( InsideUtil::isLeft( *prev, *middle, *next ) == 0 ) {
00089          // Is neither left or right.
00090          // The middle coordinate is bad.
00091          mc2dbg8 << "[removeSomePolygonDefects]: Defects found." << endl;
00092          stupid = true;
00093       } else {
00094          // Left or right could be determined. Good.
00095          *outIt++ = *middle;
00096          
00097          // Step forward.
00098          prev = middle;
00099       }
00100       
00101       middle = next;
00102       ++next;
00103    }
00104    MC2_ASSERT( last != end );
00105 
00106    // Make sure the coordinates are in the same order as before if nothing
00107    // has been removed.
00108    if ( output.size() >= 2 ) {
00109       output.front() = output.back();
00110       output.pop_back();
00111    } else {
00112       // Better to have an empty vector than having a stupid polygon.
00113       output.clear();
00114       MC2_ASSERT( stupid );
00115       // Blank and stupid looking!
00116    }
00117      
00118    if ( stupid && ! output.empty() ) {
00119       // There may still be stupid coordinates. Run again until no stupidness found.
00120       VECTOR tmp;
00121       tmp.swap( output );
00122       removeSomePolygonDefects( output, tmp.begin(), tmp.end() );
00123    }
00124 
00125    // Maintain manually closed polygons.
00126    if ( *begin == *last && !output.empty() && output.front() != output.back() ) {
00127       output.push_back( output.front() ); 
00128    }
00129 
00130    if ( stupid ) { 
00131       if ( false ) {
00132          mc2log << "[removeSomePolygonDefects]: Dumping defect poly" << endl;
00133          cout << "cat > after.gnu << EOF" << endl;
00134          cout << GnuPlotDump::gp_vec_dump( output.begin(),
00135                                            output.end() ) << endl;
00136          cout << "EOF" << endl;
00137          cout << "cat > before.gnu << EOF" << endl;
00138          cout << GnuPlotDump::gp_vec_dump( begin, 
00139                                            end ) << endl;
00140          cout << "EOF" << endl;
00141          cout << "gnuplot" << endl;
00142          cout << "plot \"before.gnu\" with vectors, "
00143               << "\"after.gnu\" with vectors";
00144          cout << endl << flush;
00145       }
00146    } else {
00147       // No stupidness found, so double check that all is OK.
00148       VECTOR orig( begin, end );
00149       MC2_ASSERT( output == orig );
00150    }
00151 
00152 }
00153 
00154 }
00155 
00156 #endif
